title: Summer destinations worth a visit in fall [Photos]
text:
By Nicole Feenstra , Postmedia Network First posted: Friday, September 11, 2015 06:00 AM MDT Summer destinations worth a visit in fall Previous Next 
Banff National Park, Alberta: Banff National Park is a gorgeous summer destination, famed for beautiful vistas, superb camping and scenic hiking. There's no need to cross the park off your fall travel list, though, as the gorgeous colours of fall set the park ablaze with reds, yellows and oranges. Dress warm and set out on a fall foliage hike you won't forget. (Fotolia) Natalia Pushchina - Fotolia 
Boston, Massachusetts: Known as "America's Walking City," Boston offers many historic sites and attractions for visitors to discover in the summer. However, tourists may enjoy visiting this northeastern U.S. destination even more in the fall. Boston, and Massachusetts as a whole, sees glorious colours in autumn, making this the perfect time of year to visit if you want to see the foliage. Plus, visitors can take in the public market, museums or catch the NFL's New England Patriots in action. (Fotolia) Bastos - Fotolia 
Churchill, Manitoba: This northern destination is a popular summer escape for those who wish to spot a few polar bears in their natural habitat. Come late autumn, Churchill is a prime destination for viewing other natural wonders, like the Aurora Borealis -- also known as the Northern Lights. (Fotolia) sharpphotos - Fotolia 
Myrtle Beach, South Carolina: If you're longing for a beach escape this autumn, keep Myrtle Beach in mind. The popular summer destination for Canadians offers plenty of beach fun into the autumn season, just miles from the airport. Stroll the renovated beach boardwalk, take a ride in the high flying skywheel or relax in temperate conditions seaside. Stop by Myrtle Beach's Aspen Grill for fresh seafood and seasonal fare. (Fotolia) Refocus Photography - Fotolia 
Niagara-on-the-Lake, Ontario: Niagara-on-the-Lake is famed as a summer wine destination, with lovely fruit festivals, quaint restaurants and shops and plenty to see on a summer stroll. Visit in autumn when the leaves change colour, exciting wine vintages are revealed and there's a hint of the fall harvest in the air. (Fotolia) Vibe Images - Fotolia 
New York City, New York: The Big Apple comes alive in autumn, when many tourists head out of the city and the real New Yorkers come back after escaping the summer heat in the Hamptons. Take advantage of great seasonal deals during your fall trip to New York City and enjoy the best cultural offerings New York has to offer, whether experiencing the changing colours at Central Park or strolling by exhibits at the Guggenheim. (Fotolia) Beboy - Fotolia 
Paris, France: This European capital is one of the world's most visited cities. Avoid the summer hustle and bustle and see a different side of Paris on an autumn visit. See fall foliage while you stroll to museums and art galleries, take in wine harvest festivities or bundle up and experience Paris' nightlife when the sun sets early in the fall sky. (Fotolia) Beboy - Fotolia 
San Francisco, California: Cruise the California coast in San Francisco, one of the most happening tourist destinations in the Pacific state. You'll be able to enjoy all those great outdoor activities in the sunny San Fran climate, from cycling to outdoor dining, even as temperatures cool elsewhere. (Fotolia) Andy - Fotolia 
Las Vegas, Nevada: Vegas is hot, hot, hot in summer, alive with pool parties, nightclub patios and non-stop fun. Sin City doesn't close its doors in autumn, though. Daytime temperatures in this desert destination remain in the mid-20s or higher, meaning you can get up to plenty of naughty fun in Vegas no matter how cool the temperature gets back home. (Fotolia) rabbit75_fot - Fotolia 
Quebec City, Quebec: The oldest walled city north of Mexico, Quebec City is alive with culture, history and architecture. Perfect for discovering during a summer stroll, Quebec City is equally charming in autumn when the temperatures are still comfortable. Be sure to visit the iconic Fairmont Chateau Frontenac and those fortified city walls, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. (Fotolia) Article
